title: 4 cycling brands embracing a greener Black Friday
content:
Cyclist
4 cycling brands embracing a greener Black Friday

If, like me, you prefer to embrace the greener side of Black Friday, here are a few cycling brands doing cool, more ethically sound stuff specifically for this ultra-consumeristic day/week.

  1. Albion is offering free repairs on any brand of cycling clothing at Condor Cycles and VIA Atelier on Wednesday 22nd November
  2. Brompton is offering free bike hire on Black Friday, 24th November with the code BLACKRIDEDAY from locations nationwide
  3. Parcours is participating in a Plastic Bank initiative doubling the amount of bottles rescued and recycled for every wheelset bought for the remainder of November
  4. Ortlieb is offering free repairs for a week in the US and UK customers can have their bag repaired for free (just price of postage)

1. Albion Rapid Repair Roadshow

The clothing brand is taking its mobile repair studio on the road, popping up at two central London locations on Wednesday 22nd of November to offer free repair on any brand of cycling clothing.

Albion will be at Condor Cycles from 8am until 2pm, and at VIA Atelier from 5pm until 8.30pm. The brand is offering free rapid repairs on any brand of cycling clothing using the Albion patch repair kit, advice and demonstrations of how to use the repair kit at home, and free repair kits. There’s also an evening screening of the brand’s new film ‘Le Coursier’ which is about ultracyclist Marin de Saint-Exupéry at 7pm at VIA Atelier.

2. Brompton free bike hire

Using the promo code BLACKRIDEDAY new and existing customers can hire a Brompton (read our guide to the range) for free from locations nationwide.

Users need to download the Brompton Bike Hire app and register their details (have a card and form of ID handy), apply the promo code and then hire from a locker that’s convenient to them and return when finished.

Beyond the day, bikes can be kept for 24 hours, a week or longer, depending on the need at just £5 a day.

3. Parcours Plastic Bank

The wheel maker is partnering with Greenspark, a platform which assists businesses on their way to being more sustainable, and participating in Plastic Bank, which builds ethical recycling ecosystems in coastal communities around the world. The plastic is sorted, weighed and exchanged for digital tokens that can be redeemed for basic necessities such as groceries, cooking fuel, school tuition, and health insurance.

Through the partnership with Greenspark, for each purchase, Parcours customers will be rescuing and recycling the following amounts:

  • 2 plastic bottles rescued – small orders (accessories etc.)
  • 20 plastic bottles rescued – non-aero wheels (Alta, Paniagua)
  • 35 plastic bottles rescued – shallow depth wheels (Ronde, Grimpeur)
  • 40 plastic bottles rescued – mid-depth wheels (Strade, Passista)
  • 50 plastic bottles rescued – deep section wheels (Chrono, Disc)

For this Black Friday, and the remainder of November, for every wheelset bought, Parcours will double the number of bottles rescued and recycled (for example, 100 bottles for a Chrono wheelset).

4. Ortlieb Repair Week

The bike bag brand is offering a Repair Week, taking place from now until December 3rd in the US.

UK customers can have their bag repaired for free (just price of postage). They should email ortlieb@lyon.co.uk, with photos of the damaged bag to organize their repair.
